newsitem.title: USA: Happiness Express to revise statements.
newsitem.headline: Happiness Express to revise statements.

text.p: Happiness Express Inc said on Wednesday that its independent auditors have determined that it will be necessary to revise its audited financial statements for the fiscal year ended March 31, 1995.
The company said that the auditors, Coopers & Lybrand LLP, have also recommended that it revise its unaudited financial statements for the the first three quarters of its 1996 fiscal year.
According to Happiness Express, Coopers & Lybrand has withdrawn its auditor's report for fiscal 1995.
In May, the company reported that it was the target of a federal probe and that investigators had taken financial records.
The company said that trading in its shares was suspended in May and that its stock was subsequently delisted from the Nasdaq Stock Market.
